findings.title: Total contribution is not reduced when stakes are withdrawn
findings.description: The `withdraw()` function reduces the contribution of `msg.sender`, but fails to update the `_totalContributions` variable. This leads to incorrect pool shares and, therefore, incorrect reward distributions.

findings.title: Land owned may not be accurate during reward calculation
findings.description: Contributions are calculated using the number of land NFT at the time of staking, which can change anytime and be exploited by transferring land between addresses to increase individual contributions.

findings.title: Potential reentrancy from token contract
findings.description: The stake() and withdraw() functions call their equivalents in the LPTokenWrapper contract, which in turn calls the external token, potentially leading to a reentrancy vulnerability if the token is untrusted or allows untrusted code execution.

findings.title: No Check for notifyRewardAmount
findings.description: It is possible for this function to be called with a different amount than what was sent to the contract, possibly making rewards insufficient for all stakers.

findings.title: Reward calculation performed twice
findings.description: The function `getReward()` calls the `earned()` function twice, once through the `updateReward()` modifier and then again immediately, introducing unnecessary logic to be executed.
